subject: Re: [junit] tearDown Problem
msgSnippet: ... It depends: what s v.size()? I bet it s not 1. If tearDown() throws an exception, life is bad, because it stops executing and you never find out why. I
messageBody:
Ranjeet Sahay wrote:

> Hi,
> I am bit curious as when tearDown is called, as what point resources are
> void.
> Simple Test code :
>
> 1. protected void tearDown() {
> 2. System.out.println("tear down 1");
> 3. assertTrue("Size is incorrect",v.size()==1);
> 4. System.out.println("tear down 2="+v.size());
> 5. }

> Lines 2&3 are executed but not line 4. Is this expected behavior ?

It depends: what's v.size()? I bet it's not 1.

If tearDown() throws an exception, life is bad, because it stops
executing and you never find out why. I think this has been discussed at
length in this group, but since I never throw an exception from
tearDown(), I don't know anything about it.

To answer your question, read the source for method runBare():

try {
setUp();
runTest();
}
catch (...) {
...
}
tearDown();

This is executed for each test.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
